Question Set #1:

<a href="https://www.gitbook.com/?utm_source=content&amp;utm_medium=trademark&amp;utm_campaign=-MWyt4j29ReMyImgcaO7" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1uwl36a r-z2wwpe r-1rasi3h r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-1fdo3w0 r-1mnahxq r-ymttw5 r-5njf8e r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-eu3ka r-1aockid" /></a>

Powered By <span class="css-901oao css-16my406 r-b88u0q">GitBook</span>

Using Web Components in React

<span key="fd1a978b7a474aecbf890aa504639424"><span offset-key="fd1a978b7a474aecbf890aa504639424:0">React and </span></span><a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Web_Components" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="45c8ccffa2444f01b78b0d47dc7e70a2" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-2575_259-2576-237__"><span data-key="b9d29f674fd94db7b037aafa09d8b4b2"><span data-offset-key="b9d29f674fd94db7b037aafa09d8b4b2:0">Web Components</span></span></span></a><span key="90c05e07eb5d4776a12b2c78e36b4b9b"><span offset-key="90c05e07eb5d4776a12b2c78e36b4b9b:0"> are built to solve different problems. Web Components provide strong encapsulation for reusable components, while React provides a declarative library that keeps the DOM in sync with your data. The two goals are complementary. As a developer, you are free to use React in your Web Components, or to use Web Components in React, or both.</span></span>

<span key="6357a3db726a483884d8ad39be9db872"><span offset-key="6357a3db726a483884d8ad39be9db872:0">Most people who use React don’t use Web Components, but you may want to, especially if you are using third-party UI components that are written using Web Components.</span></span>

# 

<span key="146ddaaff32e4180a311f420abf96778"><span offset-key="146ddaaff32e4180a311f420abf96778:0">Using Web Components in React</span></span>

1

<span key="d50b0b2392944a5599713e27a3b0bd87"><span offset-key="d50b0b2392944a5599713e27a3b0bd87:0">class HelloMessage extends React.Component {</span></span>

2

<span key="626d7efe38a14b55a08c568911ae5445"><span offset-key="626d7efe38a14b55a08c568911ae5445:0"> render() {</span></span>

3

<span key="8a0bbe25b784497da5fbe69b071f0ab5"><span offset-key="8a0bbe25b784497da5fbe69b071f0ab5:0"> return &lt;div>Hello &lt;x-search>{this.props.name}&lt;/x-search>!&lt;/div>;</span></span>

4

<span key="6b487dcac1cd4c2584f4e50f0f247039"><span offset-key="6b487dcac1cd4c2584f4e50f0f247039:0"> }</span></span>

5

<span key="e6633fdf978a4839aa666b0dcf8de34b"><span offset-key="e6633fdf978a4839aa666b0dcf8de34b:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

> <span key="e60a0149f89b4672858d071f359e0632"><span offset-key="e60a0149f89b4672858d071f359e0632:0">Note:</span></span>
>
> <span key="ee323cf3ca9d4ad39180d24f4a512394"><span offset-key="ee323cf3ca9d4ad39180d24f4a512394:0">Web Components often expose an imperative API. For instance, a </span>`video`<span offset-key="ee323cf3ca9d4ad39180d24f4a512394:2"> Web Component might expose </span>`play()`<span offset-key="ee323cf3ca9d4ad39180d24f4a512394:4"> and </span>`pause()`<span offset-key="ee323cf3ca9d4ad39180d24f4a512394:6"> functions. To access the imperative APIs of a Web Component, you will need to use a ref to interact with the DOM node directly. If you are using third-party Web Components, the best solution is to write a React component that behaves as a wrapper for your Web Component.</span></span>
>
> <span key="a20fd591e03745da9b3efecfa7007954"><span offset-key="a20fd591e03745da9b3efecfa7007954:0">Events emitted by a Web Component may not properly propagate through a React render tree. You will need to manually attach event handlers to handle these events within your React components.</span></span>

<span key="2c04f15819bf4171bbe66c8fedf7eb08"><span offset-key="2c04f15819bf4171bbe66c8fedf7eb08:0">One common confusion is that Web Components use “class” instead of “className”.</span></span>

1

<span key="03da27ca40a74526aad0be13b70a2a5c"><span offset-key="03da27ca40a74526aad0be13b70a2a5c:0">function BrickFlipbox() {</span></span>

2

<span key="a0ef2e6953584deaac44afc4df864a0a"><span offset-key="a0ef2e6953584deaac44afc4df864a0a:0"> return (</span></span>

3

<span key="90c403a2eaaa415f9f0744974d4daf5f"><span offset-key="90c403a2eaaa415f9f0744974d4daf5f:0"> &lt;brick-flipbox class="demo"></span></span>

4

<span key="67d4ca2a6f0d493b86f7b0199e1c1686"><span offset-key="67d4ca2a6f0d493b86f7b0199e1c1686:0"> &lt;div>front&lt;/div></span></span>

5

<span key="537b9adf4a844960983488ec0e2663ff"><span offset-key="537b9adf4a844960983488ec0e2663ff:0"> &lt;div>back&lt;/div></span></span>

6

<span key="0421cb6697c342deb1466749bfe53347"><span offset-key="0421cb6697c342deb1466749bfe53347:0"> &lt;/brick-flipbox></span></span>

7

<span key="568800bb3edb4e5ba08c0c1017628600"><span offset-key="568800bb3edb4e5ba08c0c1017628600:0"> );</span></span>

8

<span key="130b9fef5cb64b45a69791b527a51068"><span offset-key="130b9fef5cb64b45a69791b527a51068:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

# 

<span key="a53aa6e2a08e44a28a74aed5be4932dd"><span offset-key="a53aa6e2a08e44a28a74aed5be4932dd:0">Using React in your Web Components</span></span>

1

<span key="185b5524b9994a47a4d0c5a872288542"><span offset-key="185b5524b9994a47a4d0c5a872288542:0">class XSearch extends HTMLElement {</span></span>

2

<span key="96ad4f9de87c4ffda397a8443a313246"><span offset-key="96ad4f9de87c4ffda397a8443a313246:0"> connectedCallback() {</span></span>

3

<span key="647d1ee6aa5b41c4a8e2c3222f5d2387"><span offset-key="647d1ee6aa5b41c4a8e2c3222f5d2387:0"> const mountPoint = document.createElement('span');</span></span>

4

<span key="55a58ec10665477da71f1c4a1a186d11"><span offset-key="55a58ec10665477da71f1c4a1a186d11:0"> this.attachShadow({ mode: 'open' }).appendChild(mountPoint);</span></span>

5

<span key="750d150198b3471d966d87a5350d461c"><span offset-key="750d150198b3471d966d87a5350d461c:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

6

<span key="d66ad11b1b9b488e990270c81e3c94b7"><span offset-key="d66ad11b1b9b488e990270c81e3c94b7:0"> const name = this.getAttribute('name');</span></span>

7

<span key="d3ad0a0fd99d42b2bf13dc8073ad6bd5"><span offset-key="d3ad0a0fd99d42b2bf13dc8073ad6bd5:0"> const url = 'https://www.google.com/search?q=' + encodeURIComponent(name);</span></span>

8

<span key="6f0df2a7f50b4438a3ce702e093a7d88"><span offset-key="6f0df2a7f50b4438a3ce702e093a7d88:0"> ReactDOM.render(&lt;a href={url}>{name}&lt;/a>, mountPoint);</span></span>

9

<span key="b4bc8d5a156e442cb00c354d5426cdae"><span offset-key="b4bc8d5a156e442cb00c354d5426cdae:0"> }</span></span>

10

<span key="ce4b08b839a14d43853dfaef61ec637b"><span offset-key="ce4b08b839a14d43853dfaef61ec637b:0">}</span></span>

11

<span key="76ea3880a179428db503124be4422bb2"><span offset-key="76ea3880a179428db503124be4422bb2:0">customElements.define('x-search', XSearch);</span></span>
